question.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
Resolves **Yes** if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

metadata.source_question: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

question.title: Will the Republican nominee in 2024 be a woman?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Republican Party officially nominates a woman as its candidate for President of the United States for the 2024 election. The nomination must be confirmed during the Republican National Convention or through an official announcement by the Republican National Committee. If a woman is nominated but does not accept the nomination or withdraws before the election, the question will resolve as No. The criteria for determining the nominee include the official results from the Republican primaries and caucuses, as recognized by the Republican National Committee.

metadata.source_question: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

question.title: Will a female member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, one of the following individuals is officially nominated by the Republican Party as its candidate for President of the United States for the 2024 election, and that individual is a woman:

 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump

The nomination must be confirmed during the Republican National Convention or through an official announcement by the Republican National Committee. If a woman is nominated but does not accept the nomination or withdraws before the election, the question will resolve as No. The criteria for determining the nominee include the official results from the Republican primaries and caucuses, as recognized by the Republican National Committee.

metadata.source_question: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

question.title: Will Donald Trump run for President again in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Donald Trump officially announces his candidacy for the 2024 Presidential election. The announcement must be made through a credible source such as a press conference, an official campaign website, or a verified social media account. Additionally, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the announcement will also suffice. If he is listed on the ballot for the 2024 Presidential election, this will also resolve the question as Yes, regardless of prior announcements. Any campaign that is considered a joke or satirical will not count towards this resolution.

metadata.source_question: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

question.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 and will Donald Trump run for President again in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur:

(a) One of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

(b) By December 31, 2024, Donald Trump officially announces his candidacy for the 2024 Presidential election. The announcement must be made through a credible source such as a press conference, an official campaign website, or a verified social media account. Additionally, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the announcement will also suffice. If he is listed on the ballot for the 2024 Presidential election, this will also resolve the question as Yes, regardless of prior announcements. Any campaign that is considered a joke or satirical will not count towards this resolution.

metadata.source_question: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

question.title: Will a Trump family member hold a significant political office by 2026?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2026, any member of the Trump family (including Donald Trump, Ivanka Trump, Eric Trump, Donald Trump Jr., or Tiffany Trump) holds a significant political office. A 'significant political office' is defined as any elected position at the federal or state level in the United States, including but not limited to: President, Vice President, U.S. Senator, U.S. Representative, Governor, or any other statewide elected office. The office must be held officially and not in an interim capacity. The resolution will be based on official election results or appointments confirmed by reputable news sources such as the New York Times, Washington Post, or CNN. If a family member holds a position that is not widely recognized as significant, the question will resolve as No.

metadata.source_question: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

question.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 and hold a significant political office by 2026?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** only if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024. This includes any of the following individuals:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

(b) By December 31, 2026, any member of the Trump family (including Donald Trump, Ivanka Trump, Eric Trump, Donald Trump Jr., or Tiffany Trump) holds a significant political office. A 'significant political office' is defined as any elected position at the federal or state level in the United States, including but not limited to: President, Vice President, U.S. Senator, U.S. Representative, Governor, or any other statewide elected office. The office must be held officially and not in an interim capacity. The resolution will be based on official election results or appointments confirmed by reputable news sources such as the New York Times, Washington Post, or CNN. If a family member holds a position that is not widely recognized as significant, the question will resolve as No.

question.title: Which political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? (EPP)
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** for the political group that holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

metadata.source_question: Which political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? (EPP)

question.title: Will the number of seats held by the EPP exceed 200 after the 2024 elections?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, after the conclusion of the 2024 European Parliament elections, the European People's Party (EPP) holds more than 200 seats in the European Parliament as officially reported by the European Parliament's official website. The seat count must be based on the final allocation of seats post-election, including any adjustments made during the official counting process. If there are any disputes regarding the seat count, the resolution will rely on the final count as certified by the European Parliament. In the case of a tie or uncertainty, the question will resolve as No.

metadata.source_question: Which political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? (EPP)

question.title: Will the EPP hold the most seats and exceed 200 seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if BOTH of the following conditions are met:

(a) The European People's Party (EPP) holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This is based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, this condition will resolve as Yes for both groups.

(b) The EPP holds more than 200 seats in the European Parliament after the conclusion of the 2024 elections. This count must be based on the final allocation of seats post-election, including any adjustments made during the official counting process, and as certified by the European Parliament. If there are any disputes or uncertainties regarding the seat count, this condition will resolve as No.

question.title: Which political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? (EPP)
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** for the political group that holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

metadata.source_question: Which political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? (EPP)

question.title: Will a political group other than the EPP gain more than 50 seats in the 2024 elections?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, a political group other than the European People's Party (EPP) gains more than 50 seats in the European Parliament. The outcome will be based on the official results published by the European Parliament or validated by a reputable news source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). In the case of coalition agreements, the count of seats must be independently verified and officially recognized. The political groups considered must be defined as per the official classifications used by the European Parliament at the time of the election.

metadata.source_question: Which political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? (EPP)

question.title: Will the EPP hold the most seats and will a political group other than the EPP gain more than 50 seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The European People's Party (EPP) holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and (b) A political group other than the EPP gains more than 50 seats in the European Parliament. 

Condition (a) will resolve on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, this condition will resolve as Yes for both groups.

Condition (b) will resolve based on the official results published by the European Parliament or validated by a reputable news source (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). In the case of coalition agreements, the count of seats must be independently verified and officially recognized. The political groups considered must be defined as per the official classifications used by the European Parliament at the time of the election.

question.title: Which political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? (EPP)
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** for the political group that holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

metadata.source_question: Which political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? (EPP)

question.title: Will the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections result in a significant shift in the political landscape of the EU?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, there is a clear and significant shift in the political landscape of the European Union as a result of the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections. A significant shift is defined as any of the following: (1) A change in the majority party or coalition in the European Parliament compared to the previous election, (2) A substantial increase or decrease (greater than 10 seats) in the number of seats held by any political group compared to the 2019 elections, (3) The emergence of a new political group or coalition that alters the balance of power within the Parliament. The assessment will be based on official election results published by the European Parliament and confirmed by reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters).

metadata.source_question: Which political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? (EPP)

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The EPP will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) There will be a significant shift in the political landscape of the EU as a result of the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the EPP holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** otherwise. If two groups are tied for seats, this sub-question will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, by December 31, 2024, there is a clear and significant shift in the political landscape of the European Union as a result of the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections. A significant shift is defined as any of the following: (1) A change in the majority party or coalition in the European Parliament compared to the previous election, (2) A substantial increase or decrease (greater than 10 seats) in the number of seats held by any political group compared to the 2019 elections, (3) The emergence of a new political group or coalition that alters the balance of power within the Parliament. The assessment will be based on official election results published by the European Parliament and confirmed by reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters).

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

metadata.source_question: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?

question.title: Will Scotland achieve a majority vote in favor of independence in a referendum by 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Scotland holds a referendum on independence and a majority of the votes cast (more than 50%) are in favor of independence. The referendum must be officially recognized and conducted under the auspices of the Scottish Government, with oversight by the Electoral Commission to ensure fairness and transparency. The results must be published and reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, The Times, etc.). In the event of a close result (i.e., within 1% of 50%), the question will resolve as No unless there is clear evidence of a majority in favor.

metadata.source_question: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, and achieve a majority vote in favor of independence by December 31, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:
(a) There is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.
(b) By December 31, 2024, Scotland holds a referendum on independence and a majority of the votes cast (more than 50%) are in favor of independence. The referendum must be officially recognized and conducted under the auspices of the Scottish Government, with oversight by the Electoral Commission to ensure fairness and transparency. The results must be published and reported by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, The Times, etc.). In the event of a close result (i.e., within 1% of 50%), the question will resolve as No unless there is clear evidence of a majority in favor.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?

This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

metadata.source_question: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?

question.title: Will Scotland hold a referendum on independence before the next UK general election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, Scotland holds a legally recognized referendum on independence from the United Kingdom. The referendum must be sanctioned by the UK Parliament or conducted under the authority of the Scottish Parliament with clear legal standing. The results of the referendum must be reported in a credible manner by at least two major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, The Times, or similar). Any informal or non-binding votes do not count towards this question's resolution.

metadata.source_question: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, and before the next UK general election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:
1. An official, sanctioned referendum on Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom is held before May 3, 2024.
2. The referendum is held before the next UK general election, which is expected to be before January 1, 2025.

For the referendum to be considered official and sanctioned, it must meet all the following criteria:
- It must have the consent of the UK government or be conducted under the authority of the Scottish Parliament with clear legal standing.
- It may be an "advisory" referendum, meaning it does not need to have any legally binding effect.
- The results of the referendum must be reported in a credible manner by at least two major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, The Times, or similar).
- It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

metadata.source_question: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?

question.title: Will any major political party in Scotland officially support independence by 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, any major political party in Scotland (defined as the Scottish National Party, Scottish Labour Party, Scottish Conservative Party, or Scottish Liberal Democrats) officially adopts a policy in support of Scottish independence. This policy must be publicly announced through an official party statement, manifesto, or conference resolution. The support must be unequivocal and cannot be contingent on future events or conditions. Any ambiguity regarding the term 'support' is clarified as a formal endorsement of independence, rather than a mere discussion or proposal. If multiple parties express support, the resolution will still be counted as Yes.

metadata.source_question: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, and will any major political party in Scotland officially support independence by 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if BOTH of the following occur: (1) There is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government. (2) By December 31, 2024, any major political party in Scotland (defined as the Scottish National Party, Scottish Labour Party, Scottish Conservative Party, or Scottish Liberal Democrats) officially adopts a policy in support of Scottish independence. This policy must be publicly announced through an official party statement, manifesto, or conference resolution. The support must be unequivocal and cannot be contingent on future events or conditions. Any ambiguity regarding the term 'support' is clarified as a formal endorsement of independence, rather than a mere discussion or proposal. If multiple parties express support, the resolution will still be counted as Yes.
